assoc_actor_2: Darfur Joint Forces/JSAMF: Joint Force of Armed Struggle Movement
source: Al Mashhad Al Sudani; Alhamish Voice; Beam reports; Darfur 24; HRW; Sudan News Agency; Sudan Tribune; Sudan War Monitor; Sudan War Updates; Twitter; Wakalat; Yale School of Public Health
notes: On 11 April 2025, clashes between RSF, backed by a militia (described as an Arab militia, coded as Darfur Arab militia), and SAF, backed by Darfur Joint Forces/JSAMF, continued in Zamzam IDP camp (Al Fasher, North Darfur), with SAF artillery shelling. The Joint Forces repelled the RSF attack and killed an RSF commander. RSF attacked civilians in the camp. 25-45 civilians were killed. Fatalities coded as 26 (1 RSF + 25 civilians).

source: Sudan News; Sudan News Agency; Sudan Tribune; Twitter
notes: On 11 April 2025, clashes between RSF and Shugara-Berti continued in Umm Keddada (Um Kadadah, North Darfur). RSF overtook the area. RSF killed 10 civilians, including a doctor and patients in the hospital. RSF looted civilians and Starlink networks.

source: Alhamish Voice; Sudan News Agency; Sudan Tribune; Twitter
notes: On 11 April 2025, clashes between RSF, backed by a militia (described as an Arab militia, coded as Darfur Arab militia), and SAF, backed by Darfur Joint Forces/JSAMF, continued in El Fasher (Al Fasher, North Darfur), with RSF artillery shelling and fighter drones. 32 civilians were killed and 17 were wounded.

On 11 April 2025, hundreds of locals staged a protest in Menbij town in Aleppo countryside, demanding the withdrawal of QSD from Shuyukh town.
On 11 April 2025, a landmine from previous clashes planted by unknown gunmen exploded in Al-Tayibah town in Homs countryside, seriously injuring a man. There were no fatalities.
On 11 April 2025, an unknown explosion by an unknown armed group took place on Ariha-Mhambal road in Idleb countryside, killing a civilian, and injuring another. 1 fatality.

On 11 April 2025, an unexploded shell from previous shelling by former regime forces, exploded near As-Saan town in Homs countryside, killing a young man, and injuring another while they were working in their farmland. 1 fatality.

On 11 April 2025, unknown masked gunmen stopped a former school manager at a temporary checkpoint on Al Waha road on the outskirts of As-Safira town in Aleppo countryside, and shot and killed him. 1 fatality.

On 11 April 2025, a landmine from previous clashes planted by unknown gunmen exploded in Hamimeh town in Deir ez Zor badia, coded to Ash Shula district, injuring a young man. There were no fatalities.
On 11 April 2025, a landmine from previous clashes planted by unknown gunmen exploded near the entrance of Bsanqul town in Idleb countryside, killing a man, and injuring another. 1 fatality.
On 11 April 2025, a landmine from previous clashes planted by unknown gunmen exploded near a hospital in Deir-ez-Zor city, injuring a young man. There were no fatalities.

On 11 April 2025, unknown gunmen in a vehicle shot and killed a former QDW member in Al 'aliliayt neighborhood in Hama city. On the same day, a civilian responsible for recruitment for the former regime was killed in Al Faraia neighborhood in Hama city. 2 fatalities.
On 11 April 2025, a landmine from previous clashes planted by unknown gunmen exploded in a vehicle in Sabka badia in Ar Raqqa countryside, killing a man. 1 fatality.

On 11 April 2025, unknown gunmen on a motorbike shot and seriously injured a man accused of collaborating with the former regime, and killed one of his escorts, in addition to injuring another in Tall Awdat Harb town in Al Hasakeh countryside. 1 fatality.

On 11 April 2025, unknown gunmen shot and injured a young man who is a former local opposition armed group member in front of his house in Um Elmayathen town in Dara countryside. There were no fatalities.
On 11 April 2025, unknown gunmen shot and injured a police member in Izra' town in Dara countryside over tribal dispute. There were no fatalities.

On 11 April 2025, a confrontation which led to armed clash with machine guns among unknown gunmen in Jizeh town in Dara countryside over an unknown dispute, resulted in killing a young man. 1 fatality.

On 11 April 2025, at the call of URT, trade unionists, pupils, students, and several URT leaders demonstrated in Bizerte (Bizerte Nord, Bizerte), waving Tunisian and Palestinian flags and holding photos of Palestinian and Lebanese leaders, along with an image of the student who died by accident while trying to raise the Palestinian flag. The protest expressed solidarity with the Palestinian people and demanded an end to the siege on Gaza.

Houthi-affiliated political officials took part in the protests.

On 11 April 2025, protesters held 2 large Houthi-sponsored protests in As Sayyani district (coded to district center As Sayyani) (Ibb) in solidarity with the Palestinian people, denouncing the US strikes in Yemen, and in support of Houthi actions against the 'Zionist enemy' in the context of the latest round of violence in Israel-Palestine. Houthi-affiliated political officials took part in the protests.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2025-)
source: Al Mashhad Al Yemeni - Pro-IRG; Yemen News Agency (SABA) - Houthi
notes: On 11 April 2025, US forces conducted 10 airstrikes targeting a Houthi positions in Al Abdiyah district (coded to district center Al Aqta) and 1 airstrike targeting a civilian house in Majzar district (coded to district center Majzar) (Marib). Casualties unknown.
